2D Metal Slug offers retro fun
 
 Like some drill sergeant from the past, Metal Slug 3 is a wake-up call to today's gamers molly-coddled with slick visuals and fancy trimmings.
 
 With its hand-animated sprites and 2D side-scrolling, this was even considered retro when released in arcades four years ago. But a more frantic shooter you will not find at the end of your joypad this year. And yes, that includes Halo 2. Simply choose your grunt and wade through five 2D side-scrolling levels of the most hectic video game blasting you will ever encounter. It is also the toughest game you are likely to play, as hordes of enemies and few lives pile the pressure on.
 
 Players must battle soldiers, snowmen, zombies, giant crabs and aliens, not to mention the huge, screen-filling bosses that guard each of the five levels.
 
 The shoot-anything-that-moves gameplay is peppered with moments of old-school genius. Fans of robotic gastropods should note the title refers, instead, to the vast array of vehicles on offer in a game stuffed with bizarre hardware. Tanks, jets and submarines can be commandeered, as well as cannon-toting camels, elephants and ostriches - more weaponry on offer than in an acre of Iraq. Doling out justice is a joy thanks to ultra responsive controls, and while this is a tough nut to crack, it is addictive enough to have you gagging for that one last go. And at a mere £20, Metal Slug 3 is as cheap as sliced, fried spuds, as the man says. Of course, most of you will ignore this, lacking as it does the visual fireworks of modern blasters. But at a time when blockbuster titles offer only a fresh lick of paint in favour of real innovation, Metal Slug 3 is a fresh gasp of air from an era when the Xbox was not even a twinkle in Bill Gates' eye.

tinyllama:1.1b: Première sortie du jeu à l'occasion de son réédition sur Xbox One, "Metal Slug 3" est un shooter à deux dimensions qui offre une étoile de tir à la manière des années 1990, bien que cette version puisse être difficile pour les nouveaux joueurs car il y a beaucoup de chances d'encaisser des ennemis et de perdre quelques points de vie.
L'objectif est simple : récupérer tous les cartouches qui se trouvent derrière chaque tour, alors que les ennemis tirent sur vos chaussures et lance-pierres pour vous frapper.

Avec un gameplay étonnamment légèrement extraordinaire, il faut commander un grand nombre de machines mobiles pour réussir, mais cela peut également être une source d'encombrements, ce qui peut les rendre inexpérimentés au combat.

L'ambiance est très populaire, grâce à des textures en 2D et à des animations de personnages, qui peuvent faire que les joueurs se sentissent comme en tant qu'éléphant qui ait vu ses parents mourir à l'aide d'un pincé.

Bien que la plupart des jeux de stratégie-shooter ne soient pas un bon exemple de réédition, il est probable que "Metal Slug 3" ait été décidé pour rééditer avec le but d'être relativement populaire pour les joueurs qui ont lu les avis et sont enchantés de la visibilité de ce jeu.

The gameplay revolves around shooting enemies and taking them out using various weapons such as rockets, missiles and grenades.
Players can also pilot vehicles like tanks, jets, submarines and camels which provide a unique perspective on combat.
The controls are simple yet responsive, making the game enjoyable for both beginners and experienced gamers alike.
Additionally, the addition of boss battles is a distinct advantage as players must outwit and outmaneuver their opponents in this thrilling part of the game.
Metal Slug 3 has an affordable price of just £20, making it an attractive purchase for anyone looking to enjoy an engaging shooter that is both challenging and fun.
